physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chronic back pain; MRI revealed multiple tumors with a large tumor in the third lumbar vertebra, positive for chromogranin A (CGA), synaptophysin, and S100.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Eighteen months later, the patient presented with progressive tumor disease; MRI showed multiple metastases in the thoracic and sacral vertebrae compressing the spinal cord.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Right-sided mixed hearing loss, pulsatile tinnitus, chronic hoarseness; laryngoscopy showed a paretic right vocal cord.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Deterioration in hearing and right-sided pulsatile tinnitus six years later.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Palpable lump on the left side of the neck; CT showed a tumor of the left carotid bifurcation suspicious of a carotid body tumor.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No relapse of the PGL has been observed by imaging since the tumor was completely removed.
